title: Twitter Workers Brace for More Departures After Musk Ultimatum
description: The company followed up with practical details after Elon Musk challenged the remaining employees to be hardcore or leave.

title: CEO in Charge of FTX Restructuring Calls It an 'Unprecedented' Mess
description: The crypto exchange exhibited a “complete failure of corporate controls,” former Enron chief John Ray said in his first detailed filing with the bankruptcy court.

title: U.K. Government Seeks Further Easing of Data Protection Rules
description: Straying too far from the European Union’s General Data Protection Regulation, however, could jeopardize a data deal with the bloc.

title: Boeing Replaces Space Chief as Defense Unit Looks to Stem Losses
description: The personnel change is part of a broader restructuring aimed at reversing losses at the aerospace company’s defense unit.

title: Stagnant Scientific Productivity Holding Back Growth
description: Institutions that fund science have become process-oriented and risk-averse, favoring established researchers pursuing incremental discoveries, some critics say.

title: Volkswagen's New CEO Puts Self-Driving Car Plans Under Review
description: Chief Executive Oliver Blume is beginning to reorder VW’s most ambitious—and fraught—endeavors to focus on near-term implementation of key software and technology for coming models.

title: Meta Employees, Security Guards Fired for Hijacking User Accounts
description: Facebook’s parent has fired or disciplined more than two dozen employees and contractors over the last year whom it accused of improperly taking over user accounts.

title: Elon Musk Takes a Hard Line on Quiet Quitters---and Anyone He Thinks Is Close
description: The Twitter Inc. CEO’s explicit ultimatum to staffers is consistent with the hard-driving approach that helped him build some of the world’s most valuable companies—but there are risks.

title: Alibaba Posts Slow Growth as China's Covid Policy Weighs
description: The Chinese e-commerce company’s 3% rise in revenue is among its weakest revenue expansions since going public.

title: Activision Blizzard to End Most Game Services in China, NetEase Partnership
description: The U.S. company’s subsidiary is ending its 14-year licensing partnership with NetEase following disagreements over issues including data control.

title: Enel to Build Massive Solar Panel Factory in U.S.
description: It would also make solar cells, a key part of the supply chain not currently produced in the U.S.

title: Elon Musk's Tesla Compensation Trial Turns to Financial Experts
description: Outside financial experts are poised to take the stand as the trial over Mr. Musk’s multibillion-dollar pay package enters its closing days.

title: FTX's Unraveling Is Latest Blow to Softening Ad Market
description: The bankrupt exchange and crypto peers had spent heavily on advertising since 2021.

title: TuSimple Co-Founder Takes Control of Self-Driving Trucking Company
description: Federal authorities are continuing to investigate the firm’s relationship with a startup tied to Mo Chen, the co-founder.
